subject: Re: [junit] Test  Dependencies

Unit test does not promote the dependencies among tests. In your case, you could test:
1. Populating unit test (first thing as you said)
2. Test business class (you can use mock object and simulate the result of retrieving data from database)

From my works, sometimes I combine these two steps into one (because populating data into database mostly belong the third-party job and I only need to test one specific case - I use Hibernate). Here are my sample unit test

@Before
public void setUp() {
    //insert data into database
}

@Test
testExample () {
    //Check whether data is populating correctly (mostly I only check the size of //data
   test objects here
}

Regards,
Hai
http://www.haiphucnguyen.net/blog/

Arash Bijanzadeh <arashbi@...> wrote:                               I have a problem with the test dependencies. The application is a
 database backed application and I want to test the db functionality.
 For this purpose, first thing to be done is database populating which
 itself is a test suite. Is there any way to specify the order or tests
 in Junit? Or any other solution which suits this kind of scenarios?
 Thanks in advance,
 Arash
